resources:
ICK Utah The Islamic Center of Kuwait in Utah is a vibrant hub for learning and community engagement, dedicated to fostering Islamic knowledge and cultural exchange. Originally established as a community center, it was renamed in November 2014 following a generous one-million-dollar donation from the State of Kuwait, directed by His Highness Emir Sheikh Sabah Al-Ahmad Al-Jaber Al-Sabah. Under the leadership of Imam Mohammed Al-Tigar, president and chair of the Islamic Center of Kuwait in South Ogden, the center has flourished as a place of worship, education, and cultural outreach. It is home to a large Islamic library, featuring over 1,000 books and scientific texts, providing valuable resources on Islamic studies, history, and scholarly research. Serving as a beacon of education and spirituality, the center continues to support intellectual and cultural enrichment for visitors and scholars alike.
